intro: Cirsium bracteatum, commonly known as the bracted thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, spiny leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–120 cm, with grey-green, lobed leaves covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually purple to pink, forming dense clusters at the top of the plant. Cirsium bracteatum is often found in dry meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
